Major Cities in South America | Generated by AI

Home 2025.09

Here are some of the major cities in South America, organized by country:

🇧🇷 Brazil

  • São Paulo – Largest city in South America by population and a major financial hub.
  • Rio de Janeiro – Famous for its beaches, carnival, and landmarks like Christ the Redeemer.
  • Brasília – The capital city, known for its modernist architecture.

🇦🇷 Argentina

  • Buenos Aires – Capital and largest city, a cultural and economic center.
  • Córdoba – Major university city and industrial hub.
  • Rosario – Important port city on the Paraná River.

🇨🇱 Chile

  • Santiago – Capital and largest city, nestled in a valley surrounded by the Andes.
  • Valparaíso – Key port city with unique architecture.

🇵🇪 Peru

  • Lima – Capital and largest city, a mix of colonial history and modern business.
  • Arequipa – Known for its architecture and volcanic surroundings.

🇨🇴 Colombia

  • Bogotá – Capital and largest city, located in the Andes.
  • Medellín – Known for innovation and urban development.
  • Cali – Cultural hub, especially for salsa music.

🇻🇪 Venezuela

  • Caracas – Capital city, though facing economic and social challenges.
  • Maracaibo – Major oil-producing city.

🇪🇨 Ecuador

  • Quito – Capital city located high in the Andes.
  • Guayaquil – Largest city and a major port.

🇺🇾 Uruguay

  • Montevideo – Capital and cultural center.
  • Punta del Este – Popular beach resort town.

🇵🇾 Paraguay

  • Asunción – Capital and largest city.
  • Ciudad del Este – Important commercial city near the tri-border with Brazil and Argentina.

🇧🇴 Bolivia

  • La Paz – Administrative capital, located at high altitude.
  • Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Largest city and economic center.

🇬🇾 Guyana

  • Georgetown – Capital and largest city.

🇸🇷 Suriname

  • Paramaribo – Capital and main urban center.

🇫🇷 French Guiana (an overseas territory of France)

  • Cayenne – Capital city.

Want a map or categorized list based on population, economy, or region?
